clinical_study.brief_title: How the Elderly Live With Pain in Heart Failure
clinical_study.official_title: How the Elderly Live With Pain in Heart Failure

collaborator.agency: McNeil Consumer Healthcare Division of McNEIL-PPC, Inc.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Data and Safety Monitoring Board

brief_summary.textblock: The How the Elderly Live with Pain in Heart Failure (HELP-HF) study provides the opportunity to assess the complaints of pain in a cohort of HF patient admitted to Thomas Jefferson University Hospital (TJUH). Additional information on their existing co-morbid conditions, an inventory of their prescribed medications, and details regarding the type of treatment interventions (over the counter analgesia and other comfort practices) they report using will be collected.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Change in characteristics and frequency of pain in a cohort of HF patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time of enrollment date and after 30 days.
primary_outcome.description: Assessment will be completed at baseline time of enrollment during hospitalization and again at 30 days after discharge. The instrument used is the Brief Pain Inventory questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the analgesia and comfort measures selected to treat pain by a cohort of HF patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of enrollment date and after 30 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment will be completed at baseline time of enrollment during hospitalization and again at 30 days after discharge. The instrument used is a modified Pain Intervention Measurement questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the relationship between pain and self- reported QOL in a cohort of HF patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of enrollment date and after 30 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment will be completed at baseline time of enrollment during hospitalization and again at 30 days after discharge. The instrument used is the Kansas City Cardiomyopathy questionnaire.

arm_group.description: A single cohort group of elderly patients hospitalized for heart failure.

study_pop.textblock: Men and women age 60 or greater hospitalized with acute decompensated heart failure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women â‰¥ 60 years.
- Admission to hospital for worsening HF
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of uncontrolled hypertension.
- Severe valve disease.
- End-stage (Stage D) HF, including treatment with chronic ionotropic drugs or left ventricular assist device support.
- Advanced malignancy or other medical condition with life expectancy less than 2 years or undergoing active chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
- Advanced chronic kidney disease (CKD) defined as estimated glomerular filtration rate (GFR) < 20 mL/min/1.73 m2 based upon the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) study equation), or on chronic or intermittent dialysis or dialysis anticipated within the next 6 months.
- Chronic anemia with hemoglobin < 9 gm/dl for males, < 8 gm/dl for females or acute anemia requiring transfusion of 2 or more units of blood.
